frame.name: Import_export
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> moves <fen>Goods</fen> (or some other useful item) from an <fen>Exporting_area</fen>, across a boundary or border to a different area, the <fen>Importing_area</fen>. The <fen>Path</fen> along which the <fen>Goods</fen> pass may also be indicated. Depending on the lexical unit, the <fen>Agent</fen> 's point of view may be centered on the <fen>Exporting_area</fen> at the beginning of the process (e.g. <ment>export</ment>) or on the <fen>Importing_area</fen> and the end of the process (e.g. <ment>import</ment>) or on the <fen>Path</fen> (e.g. <ment>transship</ment>). In some sentences, a constituent which encodes the <fen>Agent</fen> FE also encodes information about the <fen>Exporting_area</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, or <fen>Importing_area</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The conscious entity, generally a person, that moves the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex><fex name="Agent">Bath and Bodyworks</fex> <t>imports</t> all of its soaps from Scotland.</ex> Very often, an <fen>Exporting_area</fen>, <fen>Importing_area</fen>, or <fen>Path</fen> will metonymically stand in for the person or persons directly responsible for the movement of the <fen>Goods</fen>. In such cases the constituent should be labeled <fen>Agent</fen> on the first layer and with the appropriate locational FE on the second layer. <ex><fex name="Agent">The U.S.</fex> <t>exports</t> most of its peanut products.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Vehicle
FE.definition: <def-root>An mobile entity directed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that holds the <fen>Goods</fen> and moves them along from the <fen>Exporting_area</fen> to the <fen>Importing_area</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the action indicated by the target. </def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The items of value whose location is changing.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which the <fen>Agent</fen> moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.
<ex>Some department stores <t>import</t> expensive items <fex name="Purpose">to please their higher-paying customers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Reason
FE.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> is responding to in performing the action. </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the state of a participant during the action <ex>Kazakhstan <t>exported</t> the petroleum, <fex name="Depictive">gleeful</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Importing_area
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Importing_area</fen> is the place that the <fen>Goods</fen> end up as a result of motion.
</def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Path</fen> identifies the location of the <fen>Goods</fen> during transit, i.e. after leaving the <fen>Exporting_area</fen> and before reaching the <fen>Importing_area</fen>.
<ex>The <t>exportation</t> of goods <fex name="Path">across state lines</fex> is strictly prohibited.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Exporting_area
FE.definition:
<def-root>The place where the <fen>Goods</fen> are initially, before the action.
</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element is used for a characteristic or description of the <fen>Goods</fen>. Note that <fen>Descriptor</fen> is not an FE of the same character as other FEs. Specifically, rather than filling a slot, it identifies a modifier of its head noun. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: transship.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: transfer (cargo) from one ship or other form of transport to another.

lexUnit.name: import.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: bring (goods or services) into a country from abroad.

lexUnit.name: exporter.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person or (metonymically) a place that moves goods to another region.

lexUnit.name: importer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person or (metonymically) a place that moves goods into a region.

lexUnit.name: import_((entity)).n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an imported commodity, article, or service.

lexUnit.name: export_((entity)).n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an exported commodity, article, or service.

lexUnit.name: import_((act)).n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or process of importing.

lexUnit.name: export_((act)).n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the exporting of goods or services.

lexUnit.name: importation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of moving goods into an area.

lexUnit.name: trans-shipping.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of transferring cargo to move it towards its ultimate destination.

lexUnit.name: export.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: send (goods or services) to another country for sale.
